item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "Life will break you. Nobody can protect you from that, and living alone won't either, for solitude will also break you with its yearning. You have to love. You have to feel. It is the reason you are here on earth. You are here to risk your heart. You are here to be swallowed up. And when it happens that you are broken, or betrayed, or left, or hurt, or death brushes near, let yourself sit by an apple tree and listen to the apples falling all around you in heaps, wasting their sweetness. Tell yourself you tasted as many as you could." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "You can, in short, lead the life of the mind, which is, despite some appalling frustrations, the happiest life on earth. And one day, in the thick of this, approaching some partial vision, you will (I swear) find yourself on the receiving end of - of all things - an "idea for a story," and you will, God save you, start thinking about writing some fiction of your own. Then you will understand, in what I fancy might be a blinding flash, that all this passionate thinking is what fiction is about, that all those other fiction writers started as you did, and are laborers in the same vineyard." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Frank Warren
item.description: "It's the children the world almost breaks who grow up to save it." -- Frank Warren

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "It's so easy to laugh It's so easy to hate It takes guts to be gentle and kind" -- Morrissey

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by ernest hemingway
item.description: "Courage is grace under pressure." -- ernest hemingway

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Tact: the ability to describe others as they see themselves." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by E. M. Forster
item.description: "I am a Jane Austenite, and therefore slightly imbecile about [author:Jane Austen|1265]. My fatuous expression, and airs of personal immunity—how ill they sit on the face, say, of a Stevensonian! But Jane Austen is so different. She is my favourite author! I read and reread, the mouth open and the mind closed. Shut up in measureless content, I greet her by the name of most kind hostess, while criticism slumbers." -- E. M. Forster

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "What is hell? I maintain that it is the suffering of being unable to love." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "One of the things I know about writing is this: spend it all, shoot it, play it, lose it, all, right away, every time. Do not hoard what seems good for a later place in the book or for another book; give it, give it all, give it now. The impulse to save something good for a better place later is the signal to spend it now. Something more will arise for later, something better. These things fill from behind, from beneath, like well water. Similarly, the impulse to keep to yourself what you have learned is not only shameful, it is destructive. Anything you do not give freely and abundantly becomes lost to you. You open your safe and find ashes." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Love. Fall in love and stay in love. Write only what you love, and love what you write. The word is love. You have to get up in the morning and write something you love, something to live for." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Galileo Galilei
item.description: "I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use." -- Galileo Galilei

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description:
"Seven Deadly Sins
Wealth without work Pleasure without conscience Science without humanity Knowledge without character Politics without principle Commerce without morality Worship without sacrifice." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Guy de Maupassant
item.description: "There is only one good thing in life, and that is love." -- Guy de Maupassant

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Gandhi
item.description: "Your beliefs become your thoughts, Your thoughts become your words, Your words become your actions, Your actions become your habits, Your habits become your values, Your values become your destiny." -- Gandhi

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "True freedom is impossible without a mind made free by discipline." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means..." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by LeAnn Neal Reilly
item.description: "Perhaps I shouldn’t like it so much, but I’ve always been one for finding beauty in the ugliest stories." -- LeAnn Neal Reilly

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Geoffrey Wolff
item.description: "To learn something, to master something, anything, is as sweet as first love." -- Geoffrey Wolff

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Tom Clancy
item.description: "The difference between fiction and reality? Fiction has to make sense." -- Tom Clancy

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Abigail Van Buren
item.description: "The best index to a person's character is how he treats people who can't do him any good, and how he treats people who can't fight back." -- Abigail Van Buren

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "Hold fast to dreams, For if dreams die Life is a broken-winged bird, That cannot fly." -- Langston Hughes

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by LeAnn Neal Reilly
item.description: "As Viktor Frankl said about the Nazis, you’ll never own what’s inside me. There I’m always free." -- LeAnn Neal Reilly

item.title: LeAnn add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "He's satisfied with himself. If you have a soul you can't be satisfied." -- Graham Greene
